intro: Laggera crispata, commonly known as the curly leaf cudweed, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has hairy, lobed leaves that are often curled or crinkled, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Laggera crispata is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
